vulnerabilities.name: Reentrancy
vulnerabilities.description: A function calls an external contract before updating its state.

vulnerabilities.name: Integer Overflow and Underflow
vulnerabilities.description: Arithmetic operations exceed the storage limit of a data type.

vulnerabilities.name: Access Control Issues
vulnerabilities.description: Functions or variables are accessible by unauthorized users.

vulnerabilities.name: Uninitialized Storage Pointers
vulnerabilities.description: Using uninitialized storage pointers can lead to unintentional data corruption.

vulnerabilities.name: Unrestricted Write to Storage
vulnerabilities.description: Functions that can write to storage without proper checks.

vulnerabilities.name: Denial of Service (DoS)
vulnerabilities.description: Operations that can block further actions by consuming excessive gas or resources.

vulnerabilities.name: Floating Pragma
vulnerabilities.description: Using a floating pragma can lead to incompatibility with future compiler versions.

vulnerabilities.name: Self-Destruct Function
vulnerabilities.description: Presence of self-destruct functions that can be called by unauthorized users.

vulnerabilities.name: Unchecked External Call
vulnerabilities.description: Calls to external contracts that do not check the success of the call.

vulnerabilities.name: Timestamp Dependence
vulnerabilities.description: Using block timestamps for critical functionalities.

vulnerabilities.name: Block Number Dependence
vulnerabilities.description: Using block numbers for critical functionalities.

vulnerabilities.name: Unprotected Suicide
vulnerabilities.description: Contracts that can be killed by unauthorized users.

vulnerabilities.name: Signature Malleability
vulnerabilities.description: Issues with cryptographic signature verification.

vulnerabilities.name: Delegatecall Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Using delegatecall without proper validation.

vulnerabilities.name: Tx.origin Authentication
vulnerabilities.description: Using tx.origin for authorization can be exploited through phishing.

vulnerabilities.name: Short Address Attack
vulnerabilities.description: Improper handling of Ethereum addresses that are less than 20 bytes.

vulnerabilities.name: Default Visibility
vulnerabilities.description: Functions that do not specify visibility.

vulnerabilities.name: Unhandled Exceptions
vulnerabilities.description: Not handling exceptions properly from external calls.

vulnerabilities.name: Gas Limit and Loops
vulnerabilities.description: Functions that consume an excessive amount of gas.

vulnerabilities.name: Force Sending Ether to Contracts
vulnerabilities.description: Contracts that can be forced to receive ether.
